publicationStmt.p: Distributed by Digital Scholarship Services at Lafayette College

lg.l: by the Same. \meaning Swift and written on the same line as the title\
Pallas a Goddess Chast & Wise
Descending lately from the Skyes
To Neptune went & and begg'd in form
He'd give his Orders for a Storm
A Storm to drown that Rascal ----
And She wou'd kindly thank him for't
The Wretch whom Irish knaves to Spite her
Had lately honour'd with a Miter
The God who favour'd her request
Assur'd her he had done his best
But Venus had been there before
Pleaded the Bishop lov'd a Whore
And had Inlarg'd her Empire wide
He own'd no Deity beside
Att Sea or Land if e're You found him
Without a Mistress hang or drown him
Since Burnett's death the Bishop's Bench
Till ---- arriv'd n'ere kept a Wench
If ---- must Sink She grieves to tell it
She'll not have left one Single Prelate
And She must own She did Intend him
Elect for Cyprus in Comendam
And since her Birth the Ocean gave her
She Cou'd not doubt her uncle's favour
Then Proteus made the Same request
But halfe in earnest halfe in jest
Said he, Great Sover'gn of the main,
To drown him all attempts are Vain
---- Can assume more Shapes than I
A Rake, a Bully, Pimp or Spy,
Can run, or Creep, or fly, or Swim,
All motions are alike to him
Turn him adrift and You Shall find
He knows to Sail with every Wind
Or throw him over·board he'll ride
As well against as with the tide
And Pallas You apply too Late
For 'tis decreed by Iove and Fate
That Ireland must be Soon destroy'd
Then who but ---- Shou'd insbe employ'd
You need not therefore be So pert
Att Sending Bolton to Clonfert
I find You did it by Your grinning
Your business is to mind your Spinning
Or who regarded Your Report
For never were You seen att Court
But if You must have your petition
Here's Berkly in the Same Condition
Look there he Stands & 'tis but just
If ---- Shall drown the Doctor must
But if You leave us Bishop Iudas
We'll give You Berkly for Barmudas
Or if 'twill gratify your Spite
To put him in a plaguy fright
Althô 'twill hardly quitt the Cost
You Soon Shall See him Soundly Tost
You'll find him Swear, blaspheme & Damn
And ev'ry moment take a Dram
His ghastly Visage with an Air
Of reprobation and Despair
Or when Some hiding hole he Seeks
For fear the rest Should Say he Squeeks
Or as Fitzpatrick did before
Resolv'd to perish with his Whore
Or when he roars, and raves, & Stares
And but for Shame wou'd say his Prayers
Or wou'd You See his Spirits Sink
Refluxing downwards in a Stink
If Such a Scene as this can please You
Good Madam Pallas pray be Easy
Let Neptune Speak and I'll Consent
But he'll Come back ye─rogue he went
The Goddess who Conceiv'd a Hope
That ---- was destin'd for a Rope
Believ'd it best to Condescend
And insSpare a foe to Save a Friend
Yet fearing Berkly might be Scar'd
She left him Vertue for his Guard.302-020B
